artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Tsunajima Kamekichi; Carver: Wada Yūjirō
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 503.12; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 276.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: woman slightly turned to PR, with elaborate gold hair ornaments with floral motifs, wearing kimono with bold patterns, with bold red and yellow stripes on PL shoulder, bold hexagon and flower pattern in green, white, yellow, red and blue, and black with yellow and blue bamboo leaves on PR shoulder
markings: Artist’s seal: たいそ{Taiso} | Carver’s seal: 和田刻 {Wada koku}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Thirty-two Aspects of Behaviors (Fūzoku sanjūnisō 風俗三十二相)
text: No. 10 on the table of contents
title: Appearing Graceful, Behavior of a High-Ranking Prostitute of the Tenpō Era
